intro: Syngonanthus schlechteri subsp. schlechteri, commonly known as the Schlechter's cat's-tail, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It is characterized by its unique inflorescence, which resembles a cat's tail, consisting of dense clusters of small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in grasslands and open woodlands, thriving in well-drained soils. It produces small, red-brown seeds that are dispersed by wind, contributing to its distribution across its native range. The species is of interest to botanists due to its distinctive morphology and ecological adaptations.
